details.source_text: He led La Roja to the semifinals of the Euro 2020 last year, where they lost on penalties to Italy, and to the 2020-21 Nations League final, where they were beaten by France.

details.source_text: Spain's loss to Morocco was their third straight tournament exit on penalties, having also suffered defeat by that method against hosts Russia in the 2018 World Cup last 16.

details.source_text: Spain's failure to score a single penalty in Tuesday's shootout made them just the second team to do so in World Cup history, after Switzerland against Ukraine in 2006.

details.source_text: After the game, the 52-year-old coach admitted that he was to blame for the defeat as his youthful and vibrant team was nothing short of potential and quality.
details.reused_text: Imposing "his own stamp and through a defined style", the federation said the coach had "placed his faith in young talent and has given hope for the future of the Spanish national team".

details.source_text: Former Barcelona boss Luis Enrique was first appointed Spain coach in 2018, bar a four-month period in 2019 when he stepped aside due to the illness and subsequent death of his young daughter.
details.reused_text: Imposing "his own stamp and through a defined style", the federation said the coach had "placed his faith in young talent and has given hope for the future of the Spanish national team".

details.source_text: According to a statement from the Royal Spanish Football Federation, "Both the president, Luis Rubiales, and the sporting director, Jose Francisco Molina, have informed the coach of their decision."

details.source_text: "The RFEF would like to thank Luis Enrique and his entire coaching staff at the helm of the absolute national team in recent years," the statement read.
